newsitem.title: INDIA: Calcutta shares end lower on falling volumes.
newsitem.headline: Calcutta shares end lower on falling volumes.

text.p: Calcutta shares ended lower on Friday with volumes falling sharply ahead of the long weekend at the Bombay bourse, dealers said.
The Calcutta index closed 4.39 points lower at 435.04.

Dealers said that with the Bombay Stock Exchange taking a holiday on Monday and Tuesday for local festivals, speculators squared up their outstanding transactions -- resulting in falling volumes and prices moving sideways.

"The market looks very weak. There is nothing positive ahead and investors are unlikely to return in a hurry. Foreign funds too are very cautious and their bearish outlook is evident from the selling off of blue chips," stock analyst Mathew Easow said.
